page.title: 15Biography.
page.content: Mr. Swann custodian Middleham Castle for 30 yrs. He keeps it tidy, stops people climbing the walls, deals with the accounts and answers questions. He has lived in Middleham all his life; enjoys meeting the tourists. About 20,000 people visit the Castle each year. Entrance charges: 60p. Adult; 30p. Child; 30p. O.A.P. Open 9.30_ 6.30 Summer; 9.30_ 4.30 Winter. Owned by English Heritage. Tourists partic_ ularly interested in its age; how it was destroyed & whether Richard 111 was a good king. Mr. Swann says 'he was no worse than any other king and he would have done a lot for Middleham if he had not been killed at Bosworth.' Most popular purchases by tourists are Richard 111 seals. The lawns are now mowed by private contractors. The Castle was destroyed by Cromwell in 1646.
